item.title: Jatiya Party’s vote share was systematically suppressed, Shameem Patwary alleges
item.description: Jatiya Party Secretary General Shameem Haider Patwary has alleged that the party was premeditatedly defeated in the parliamentary elections. Speaking at a media briefing held on Sunday at the Dhaka Reporters’ Unity auditorium, he claimed the party’s vote share was systematically suppre

item.title: Domestic worker held over ‘killing’ elderly couple
item.description: A domestic worker accused of drugging an elderly couple and looting their flat in Uttara has been arrested. The suspect, who took up work under the fake name “Marufa”, was identified as 40-year-old Bilkis Begum, according to police. Police said she had taken the job at the house just

item.title: MTB Neo launches country's first AI-powered Personal Financial Management (PFM) feature
item.description: Mutual Trust Bank PLC (MTB) continues to lead Bangladesh’s digital banking transformation with the launch of the country's first AI-powered Personal Financial Management (PFM) feature, integrated into its flagship mobile banking platform, MTB Neo. item.title: Pakistan’s Ishaq Dar holds phone talks with Bangladesh FM
item.description: Seeking stronger cooperation, Deputy Prime Minister and Foreign Minister of Pakistan Mohammad Ishaq Dar on Sunday held a telephone conversation with Foreign Minister Dr Khalilur Rehman, felicitating him on his recent appointment. Both leaders expressed a desire to further strengthen bilateral ties

item.title: BSFF signs MoU with Thailand’s TFM on development of aquaculture sector
item.description: Bangladesh Shrimp and Fish Foundation (BSFF) and Thai Union Feedmill Public Company Limited (TFM) teamed up to strengthen long-term collaboration to facilitate the sustainable development of the aquaculture sector in Bangladesh, especially in the coastal region. item.title: Changes likely at top of police administration: Minister Salahuddin
item.description: Home Minister Salahuddin Ahmed on Sunday said changes are likely at the top level of the police administration. “Some changes will come, but it will take some time,” he told reporters at the Secretariat after a courtesy meeting at the Prime Minister’s Office. Speaking about the

item.title: First batch of BRAC Bank’s Branch Young Leaders graduates
item.description: BRAC Bank has marked a significant milestone in its talent development journey with the graduation of the first batch of Branch Young Leaders. item.title: Army reshuffle brings new DGFI chief
item.description: A major shake-up at the top levels of the Bangladesh Army has brought new leadership to key posts including the chief of general staff (CGS), principal staff officer (PSO) of the Armed Forces Division (AFD), and the head of the Directorate General of Forces Intelligence (DGFI). item.title: India, China invites Bangladesh FM to pay official visits
item.description: India, China and Pakistan on Sunday invited Foreign Minister Dr Khalilur Rahman to pay official visits to the countries at mutually convenient times. The envoys of China and India extended the invitations on behalf of their respective foreign ministers during separate meetings with the Foreign Min

item.title: BCB bans women’s team selector Manjurul Islam over ‘sexually harassing’ Jahanara
item.description: The Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) has barred Manjurul Islam from all forms of cricketing activity under its jurisdiction following allegations of sexual harassment made by former women’s team captain Jahanara Alam. The decision comes after the board reviewed recommendations from an independ

item.title: 21 women among Jamaat’s 88-member new central council
item.description: Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami has announced a new 88-member Central Working Council for the 2026–2028 term, including 21 women. item.title: Liberation war foundation of Bangladesh’s freedom: Hafiz Uddin
item.description: Liberation War Affairs Minister Hafiz Uddin Ahmed Bir Bikram has said the great Liberation War is the fundamental basis of Bangladesh’s freedom. “It would not be appropriate to equate any other movement or struggle with the Liberation War.
